column4: hi, I have 2 linux boxes both ubuntu I can see myself on each computer, but they can't see each other what should I ?
in the /etc/samba/smb.conf do your shares have the browseable option set to = yes?
yes done that
have you tried connecting to them, even though you can't see them?
depends on how you mean connected
I've tried the connect to server tools in gnome
it says with nautilus that it can't display the contents of smb://agnus/
did you set it up through gui, or cli?
there was a little youtube video I followed for setting it up.
the share is set to public yes
http://pastebin.com/m1fa49c7 there is the config :)
I'll have a look see at it
i'm not sure what the default is, but you may want to uncomment the security = user
ok
didn't help much :(
maybe, but as with most tools you need to know to use them :)
in the terminal you could try findsmb, or smbtree and see what comes up?
just 1 machine itself
did you try in #samba?
#samba ?
thanks I'm in there already ;)
